text: A military strategy is a set of ideas or policy used by armed forces to get the results they want.Gartner, Scott Sigmund, Strategic Assessment in War, Yale University Press, 1999. p. 163 Strategy is used to win combat, battles and wars. It involves planning, logistics (the movement and use of forces and equipment), and the deception of the enemy. Carl von Clausewitz is considered the creator of modern military strategy. ==Related pages== *Military science ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Military
title: Military strategy
